lesson.name: Adding JavaScript to a Web Page

quizzes.question: Where is the "script" tag typically placed?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]JavaScript in <head> [/h1]

You can place any number of scripts in an HTML document.
Typically, the script tag is placed in the head of the HTML document: [code format="html"]<html>
   <head>
     [b]<script>
     </script>[/b]
   </head>
   <body>
   </body>
</html> [/code]

quizzes.question: Where else is the "script" tag typically placed?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]JavaScript in <body>[/h1]

Alternatively, include the JavaScript in the <body> tag.[code format="html"]<html>
   <head> </head>
   <body>
    [b] <script>
     </script>[/b]
   </body>
</html>[/code]
[note]It's a good idea to place scripts at the bottom of the <body> element.
This can improve page load, because HTML display is not blocked by scripts loading.[/note]

quizzes.question:
What attribute and what value is used along with the script tag?
[!raw!]
<script {0}="text/{1}">
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]The <script> Tag[/h1]

The <script> tag can take two attributes, [b]language [/b]and [b]type[/b], which specify the script's type:[code format="html" ]<script [b]language[/b]="javascript" [b]type[/b]="text/javascript">

</script>[/code]
[note]The [b]language [/b]attribute is deprecated, and should not be used.[/note]
In the example below, we created an alert box inside the script tag, using the [b]alert()[/b] function.[code format="html" codeId="644"]<html>
   <head>
     <title></title>
     [b]<script type="text/javascript">
       alert("This is an alert box!");
     </script>[/b]
   </head>
   <body>
   </body>
</html>[/code]
[b]Result:[/b] [img id="2737" width="100%"]
[note]The [b]type [/b]attribute: <script type="text/javascript"> is also no longer required, as JavaScript is the default HTML scripting language.[/note]
